text: My mom put me and my sisters in the water to feel comfortable, to have water safety.
author: Michael Phelps

text: Even in high school, I'd tell my mom I was sick of swimming and wanted to try to play golf. She wasn't too happy. She'd say, 'Think about this.' And I'd always end up getting back in the pool.
author: Michael Phelps

text: My humanitarian work evolved from being with my family. My mom, my dad, they really set a great example for giving back. My mom was a nurse, my dad was a school teacher. But my mom did a lot of things for geriatrics and elderly people. She would do home visits for free.
author: Cat Cora

text: Growing up, my ideals were Barbra Streisand, Cher, and my mom.
author: Kevyn Aucoin

text: My mom insisted on multigrain bread and never allowed soda in the house.
author: Vin Diesel
